about.summary: Provides optimization algorithms based on sequential quadratic programming (SQP) for maximum likelihood estimation of the mixture proportions in a finite mixture model where the component densities are known. The algorithms are expected to obtain solutions that are at least as accurate as the state-of-the-art MOSEK interior-point solver (called by function "KWDual" in the 'REBayes' package), and they are expected to arrive at solutions more quickly in large data sets. The algorithms are described in Y. Kim, P. Carbonetto, M. Stephens & M. Anitescu (2012) <arXiv:1806.01412>.

name: r-mixsqp
raw_recipe:
{% set version = "0.3-43" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-mixsqp
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/mixsqp_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/mixsqp/mixsqp_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 58042d832803462ca03197a9dbd49d022378756de8996682b89e6bc009d02ce2

build:
  merge_build_host: true  # [win]
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}        # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}      # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_cxx') }}        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - llvm-openmp  # [osx]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-rcpp >=0.12.15
    - r-rcpparmadillo
    - r-irlba
    - libblas
    - liblapack
  run:
    - r-base
    - {{ native }}gcc-libs         # [win]
    - r-rcpp >=0.12.15
    - r-rcpparmadillo
    - r-irlba
    - llvm-openmp  # [osx]

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('mixsqp')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('mixsqp')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/stephenslab/mixsqp
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Provides optimization algorithms based on sequential quadratic programming (SQP) for maximum likelihood estimation of the mixture proportions in a finite mixture model where the component densities are known. The algorithms are expected to obtain solutions that are at least as accurate as the state-of-the-art
    MOSEK interior-point solver (called by function "KWDual" in the 'REBayes' package), and they are expected to arrive at solutions more quickly in large data sets. The algorithms are described in Y. Kim, P. Carbonetto, M. Stephens & M. Anitescu (2012) <arXiv:1806.01412>.
  license_family: MIT

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

The algorithms are expected to obtain solutions that are at least as accurate as the state-of-the-art MOSEK interior-point solver (called by function "KWDual" in the 'REBayes' package), and they are expected to arrive at solutions more quickly in large data sets. The algorithms are described in Y. Kim, P. Carbonetto, M. Stephens & M. Anitescu (2012) <arXiv:1806.01412>.

# Repository: CRAN

about.summary: Provides optimization algorithms based on sequential quadratic programming (SQP) for maximum likelihood estimation of the mixture proportions in a finite mixture model where the component densities are known. The algorithms are expected to obtain solutions that are at least as accurate as the state-of-the-art MOSEK interior-point solver (called by function "KWDual" in the 'REBayes' package), and they are expected to arrive at solutions more quickly in large data sets. The algorithms are described in Y. Kim, P. Carbonetto, M. Stephens & M. Anitescu (2012) <arXiv:1806.01412>.
